form.official-title: To amend section 287 of the Immigration and Nationality Act with respect to certain uniform requirements for United States immigration officers.

section.header: Uniform requirements for United States immigration officers
section.text: Section 287 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1357) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The Secretary of Homeland Security shall require covered immigration officers to identify themselves as such officers by displaying bold and visible identification during a time of action.
For the purposes of this subsection—

subparagraph.text: the term bold and visible identification means—

clause.text: identification of the agency that the covered immigration officer represents no smaller than 12 inches by 6 inches on the front or back of the uniform of such officer; and
the identification described under clause (i) is not covered by external pieces of a uniform, including external armor or accessories;

subparagraph.text: the term covered immigration officer means—

clause.text: personnel of the U.S. Customs and Border Protection;
personnel of the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement; and
any other official deputized by the Secretary of Homeland Security to engage in immigration enforcement actions.

subparagraph.text: the term time of action includes any immigration enforcement action such as a patrol, raid, pickup, or serving a warrant.
